title: How to start investing in mutual funds

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Mutual funds are the best way to start investing and save for your retirement. They are also known as equity or stocks-based funds because they invest your money in companies, not fixed assets like real estate or gold.
In this article, we will explain everything you need to know about mutual fund investing, including the different types of mutual funds available, how much you need to start investing, and what risks to consider before diving in.
If you\u2019ve ever wondered how to invest in mutual funds and where to start, you\u2019re not alone. But saving for retirement can seem like a monumental task when you\u2019re just getting started.
Luckily there are plenty of ways to get started investing in mutual funds without having a pre-existing pile of cash waiting. Keep reading to discover everything you need to know about investing in mutual funds\u2014no matter where you\u2019re starting from!`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

content.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...n}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...n,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"What is a mutual fund?"),mdx("p",null,"A mutual fund is a type of investment that pools money from many investors and uses that capital to buy stocks, bonds, or other assets. Mutual funds are \u201Cactively managed,\u201D which means a fund manager selects the investments in the fund and could buy and sell assets in the fund at any time. Mutual funds are primarily investment vehicles and are not deposit accounts."),mdx("p",null,"While there are many types of mutual funds, some of the most common funds you\u2019ll see are equity funds, fixed income funds, balanced funds, and money market funds. Equity funds invest in stocks of companies in the U.S. and abroad. They are considered \u201Criskier\u201D because there is a chance the fund could lose money. Fixed income funds invest in government and corporate bonds. They are \u201Csafer\u201D because they are less volatile and have a lower risk of losing money."),mdx("h2",null,"Mutual fund investing basics"),mdx("p",null,"A mutual fund is an investment fund that pools money from various people and invests that money in stocks, bonds, and/or other assets. Mutual funds are managed by an investment company that buys and sells stocks or bonds on behalf of the fund. Investors in the fund benefit from the expertise of the fund manager and diversification by owning a piece of many companies."),mdx("p",null,"Mutual funds are primarily investment vehicles and are not deposit accounts. They invest your money in stocks, bonds, and other assets, not cash. When you invest in a mutual fund, you are buying shares of the fund."),mdx("p",null,"Equity funds invest in stocks of companies in the U.S. and abroad. They are considered \u201Criskier\u201D because there is a chance the fund could lose money. Fixed income funds invest in government and corporate bonds. They are \u201Csafer\u201D because they are less volatile and have a lower risk of losing money."),mdx("h2",null,"How much do mutual funds cost?"),mdx("p",null,"Like with everything, investing in mutual funds comes with a cost. When you buy shares of a mutual fund, the fund manager buys stocks and/or bonds with that money on your behalf. The fund manager also has a salary, office, and other operating costs."),mdx("p",null,"Mutual fund expense ratios are the main way fund managers are compensated. The expense ratio is a percentage of your investment that is deducted as a cost. It includes the fund manager\u2019s salary and other management expenses. Mutual funds also have sales charges, or \u201Cloads,\u201D which are either deducted from your investment or taken out of the fund\u2019s profit."),mdx("p",null,"Keep in mind that these expenses are necessary and are what cover the cost of managing your fund and paying the fund manager. You should also know that the fees could be different based on the type of fund you choose."),mdx("h2",null,"Why invest in mutual funds?"),mdx("p",null,"Mutual funds are a smart way to start investing because you can get diversification by owning a piece of many stocks and bonds. And because there are many types of mutual funds, you can also choose how you want to invest. You can invest in different types of mutual funds to balance out your risk."),mdx("p",null,"For example, if you invest in an equity fund, you might want to invest in a fixed income fund to balance out your risk. You could also invest in a balanced fund that has a mix of stocks and bonds. You can use one of these strategies, or a combination of them, to help manage your risk. You can also use mutual funds, or other types of investments, as part of your savings for retirement, for a down payment on a house, or for a child\u2019s college fund."),mdx("h2",null,"Considerations before investing in mutual funds"),mdx("p",null,"Before you jump into investing in mutual funds, there are a few things you should consider. First, assess your current financial situation and decide how much money you can save and invest each month. Ideally, you want to start early and save as much as you can."),mdx("p",null,"Next, decide how much risk you are comfortable with. The risk is how much you could lose compared to how much you could make. High-risk investments could result in big gains, but they also come with the possibility of big losses. Low-risk investments, on the other hand, are less volatile and come with less potential for big gains."),mdx("p",null,"Finally, choose a mutual fund based on your financial goals and risk tolerance. You can find a list of mutual funds in the \u201Cmutual funds\u201D section of a financial website. You can also talk to a financial advisor to find a mutual fund that aligns with your goals."),mdx("h2",null,"So, how do you invest in mutual funds?"),mdx("p",null,"The first step to investing in mutual funds is to find the right fund for you. Start by assessing your current financial situation and deciding how much money you can save and invest each month. Ideally, you want to start early and save as much as you can."),mdx("p",null,"Next, decide how much risk you are comfortable with. The risk is how much you could lose compared to how much you could make. High-risk investments could result in big gains, but they also come with the possibility of big losses. Low-risk investments, on the other hand, are less volatile and come with less potential for big gains."),mdx("p",null,"Finally, choose a mutual fund based on your financial goals and risk tolerance. You can find a list of mutual funds in the \u201Cmutual funds\u201D section of a financial website. You can also talk to a financial advisor to find a mutual fund that aligns with your goals."),mdx("h2",null,"Bottom line"),mdx("p",null,"Mutual funds are a great way to start investing and saving for your retirement. It\u2019s important to decide how much risk you\u2019re comfortable with, choose a fund that aligns with your goals, and know what fees you\u2019ll pay. And remember, the earlier you start, the more time your money has to grow!"),mdx("p",null,"Now that you know everything you need to know about mutual fund investing, it\u2019s time to get started!"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Investing for Beginners - Where to Start

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"You can either love it or hate it. But investing is something that we all have to deal with at some point in our lives. If you\u2019re someone who likes math, logic, and problem-solving \u2013 and doesn\u2019t shy away from risk \u2013 then maybe investing is for you. For the rest of us, however, the idea of investing can seem a little bit scary. But don\u2019t worry; investing is much simpler than most people think, especially if you have a basic understanding of how personal finance works. Keeping a detailed record of your money isn\u2019t difficult and every person should invest their earnings for the future. Whether you have $5 or $500 to invest as a beginner, there are lots of great places to put that money so that it can grow over time. The trick is knowing which investment options are best for you and your circumstances..."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Make Your Money Work for You - Investing 101

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"People have many different reasons for saving money. Some are very frugal and use every spare penny to pay down debt, buy a home, or fund retirement plans. However, many people simply stash away their cash in a bank account hoping it will grow over time. While this is the tried-and-true method of savings, it won\u2019t help you get rich. To grow your wealth instead of simply preserving it, you need to invest your cash and work on growing that money over time. Even if you\u2019re young and have an extended road toward retirement ahead of you, there are still smart investing strategies that can help you build wealth sooner rather than later. Investing isn\u2019t complicated; even with its fancy words like \u201Casset allocation\u201D and \u201Cbeta coefficient.\u201D Here are some helpful investing tips to get started..."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: How to Build a Diversified Investment Portfolio

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"The stock market has been a great source of wealth creation for many investors. Over the past decade, the S&P 500 index alone has created more than 200% value appreciation for its long-term investors. However, investing in the stock market is not as simple as buying stocks and forgetting about them for 10 or 20 years. It requires constant monitoring, research, and analysis to identify the right opportunities and manage risk. The Great Recession of 2007-08 is a perfect example of how risky investing can be. Many people who were new to investing suffered significant losses when their investments tanked during that time. If you\u2019re thinking about investing your money in stocks, here are 10 things you need to know before doing so."))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Ins and Outs of Investing in Stocks

intro.compiledSource: const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,"Being able to invest is one of the best things about being an adult. It gives you a sense of control over your financial future and opens up a world of opportunities.But investing isn\u2019t as simple as putting some money in a stock market and hoping it goes up. There are different types of investments, strategies, risks, rewards, and management styles to consider when choosing how to invest your funds. Fortunately, you don\u2019t need to be an accountant or have a business degree to start investing and growing your money \u2014 learning about the different types of investments out there will help you make the right decision for you and your personal circumstances. This article covers everything you need to know about investing in stocks. If you need more detail or have specific questions that we haven\u2019t covered here, please visit"))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Basics of Investing - What You Need to Know

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`There\u2019s a lot of mystery and fear around investing your hard-earned money. For many people, that means they never get started. But investing your money instead of just saving it can have a big impact on your financial future. In fact, time is the enemy of your money -- the sooner you begin investing for your future, the better off you\u2019ll be.
Working with as little as $10 per month or an initial investment of $100 per month, you can begin to invest for your future. While it\u2019s not necessarily easy to become a successful investor (it does take time and effort), there are simple things you can do to get started on the right foot with minimum risk. Below are 10 investing tips for beginners that will help set you on the right path toward achieving great returns on your savings:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Why You Should Start Investing Now

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`As a millennial, you may feel like your future is bleak because of student loan debt, limited job prospects and stagnant wages. But the reality is that your financial future can be bright if you take action now. Investing as early as possible is perhaps the most effective way to grow your wealth over time.
Investing even a small amount of money now can have a big impact on your long-term financial success. Time is your greatest ally when it comes to growing your money \u2014 the earlier you begin investing, the greater potential return you will see later in life. At Intrinzik we believe that everyone should learn about personal finance and invest responsibly for their future. With this article we want to give you some insights about why you should start investing now and what are the best ways to do it:`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: Getting Started in Real Estate Investing

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:t,...e}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...e,components:t,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Real estate investing can be a very lucrative career or side gig. It may seem like a lot of work, but the truth is that it\u2019s not as difficult as you think. You\u2019ll be surprised at how simple real estate investing can be if you know what to do and where to start. If you\u2019re new to the world of real estate investing, then this blog post will help get you started down the right path.
This article will walk you through different types of real estate investments and reveal ways to get started in this market today. Even if you don\u2019t have millions of dollars lying around, there are still plenty of ways for you to get your feet wet in the world of real estate investing without breaking the bank.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: The Benefits of Investing for Retirement

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`The quality of life for most people in their golden years is directly correlated to how well they prepared for retirement. According to a recent report by the National Institute on Retirement Security, as many as one-third of Americans are at risk of being unable to maintain their current standard of living in retirement. That\u2019s because many are not putting away enough money on a regular basis.
An investment strategy that can be useful for helping you achieve your retirement goals is known as "retirement investing." This type of investing is geared toward enabling you to retire sooner with a more comfortable and secure standard of living. If you\u2019re not quite ready to retire but would like to have more financial security once you do, it\u2019s probably time to begin planning for your post-work life. A good place to start is by familiarizing yourself with the many different types of retirement investing available. Understanding these various options along with their pros and cons will help you determine which one(s) might be right for you.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
